oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Front view of the Hermitage and surrounding grounds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A drawing of the Hermitage mansion and landscape.

The Hermitage was the home of Andrew Jackson. It was built in 1819 and enlarged in 1831. It is a Greek Revival mansion located in Davidson County, Tennessee, outside of Nashville. Today, the house and grounds are a popular tourist attraction for visitors nationwide.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, --1767 - 1845
